item.title: Honey Glazed Ham
item.description: This Honey Glazed Ham is the centerpiece of any festive gathering, boasting a sweet and savory glaze that caramelizes beautifully in the oven. With its tender meat and delightful aroma, it’s sure to impress your family and friends. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 150min | Serves: 10 | #cat1761229712965 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 150 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 165 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 10

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 8-10 lb bone-in ham
  • 1 cup honey
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 1/4 cup Dijon mustard
  • Cloves
  • Pineapple rings

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C).
  2. Score the ham in a diamond pattern, making shallow cuts across the surface.
  3. Stud the ham with cloves, placing them in the intersections of the diamond pattern.
  4. In a bowl, mix together the honey, brown sugar, and Dijon mustard until well combined.
  5. Brush the glaze generously over the ham, ensuring it gets into the scored cuts.
  6. Place the ham in a roasting pan and bake for 2 hours, basting frequently with the remaining glaze.

item.title: Festive White Chocolate Peppermint Cookies
item.description: Indulge in the delightful combination of creamy white chocolate and refreshing peppermint with these festive cookies. Perfect for holiday gatherings or as a sweet treat to enjoy at home, these cookies are sure to bring joy to your celebrations. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 24 | #cat1761230294638 #mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 24

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 cup white chocolate chips
  • 1 teaspoon peppermint extract
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup crushed peppermint candies

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Add the peppermint extract and mix until combined.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
  6. Fold in the white chocolate chips and crushed peppermint candies.
  7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
  8. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden.
  9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

item.description: This Creamy Chicken Wild Rice Bake is a warm, comforting dish that brings together tender chicken, hearty wild rice, and a creamy sauce, making it perfect for family dinners or cozy nights in. With its rich flavors and satisfying texture, it's a dish that will quickly become a favorite. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 4 | #cat1761230594885 #mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound chicken breast, diced
  • 1 cup wild rice, uncooked
  • 2 cups chicken broth
  • 1 cup cream of mushroom soup
  • 1 cup mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn)
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 cup shredded cheese (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced chicken, uncooked wild rice, chicken broth, cream of mushroom soup, mixed vegetables, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
  3. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish and cover with foil.
  4. Bake for 25 minutes, then remove the foil, stir in cheese if using, and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the rice is tender.

item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 12 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 27 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 24

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup pumpkin puree
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 1/2 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 cup chocolate chips

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Add the pumpkin puree, egg, and vanilla extract, mixing until well combined.
  4. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
  6. Fold in the chocolate chips.
  7. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
  8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
  9. Allow to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 45 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 60 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 6

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 4 large onions, thinly sliced
  • 4 tablespoons butter
  • 1 teaspoon sugar
  • 4 cups beef broth
  • 1 cup white wine
  • 1 teaspoon thyme
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 baguette, sliced
  • 2 cups Gruyère cheese, shredded

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and sugar, cooking until caramelized, about 20 minutes.
  2. Stir in beef broth, wine, thyme, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes.
  3. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
  4. In a baking dish, layer half of the bread slices, pour half of the onion mixture, and sprinkle with half of the cheese. Repeat layers.
  5. Bake for 20-25 minutes until cheese is bubbly and golden.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound cooked chicken, shredded
  • 1 can white beans, drained and rinsed
  • 1 cup chicken broth
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh cilantro for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
  2. Add diced onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
  3. Stir in minced garlic, cumin, and chili powder, cooking for another minute.
  4. Add shredded chicken, white beans, and chicken broth, bringing to a simmer.
  5. Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper, cooking for an additional 10 minutes.
  6. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 24

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tablespoon cocoa powder
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 tablespoon red food coloring
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/2 cup powdered sugar for dusting

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. In a bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
  3. In another bowl, cream the butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
  4. Beat in the egg, red food coloring, and vanilla extract until well combined.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
  6. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
  7. Scoop tablespoon-sized balls of dough and roll them in powdered sugar.
  8. Place the cookies on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are set.
  9. Allow to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 4 chicken thighs, bone-in and skin-on
  • 1 cup apple cider
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh thyme for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
  2. In a large oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
  3. Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper, then add them to the skillet, skin-side down.
  4. Sear the chicken for about 5-7 minutes until the skin is golden brown.
  5. Flip the chicken and add apple cider and Dijon mustard to the skillet.
  6. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
  7. Remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving, garnished with fresh thyme.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 10 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 25 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 24

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tablespoon ground ginger
  • 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup brown sugar, packed
  • 1/2 cup molasses
  • 1 large egg
  • Royal icing for decoration
  • Assorted candies for decorating

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a bowl, whisk together flour, ginger, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt.
  2. In a separate bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar until fluffy.
  3. Beat in molasses and egg until well combined.
  4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until a dough forms.
  5. Chill the dough for at least 1 hour.
  6. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
  7. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to about 1/4 inch thick.
  8. Cut out gingerbread men shapes and place them on a baking sheet.
  9. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until edges are firm.
  10. Let cool completely before decorating with royal icing and candies.

  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon sage
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Rinse the wild rice under cold water and set aside.
  2. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until translucent.
  3. Add butternut squash and mushrooms, cooking for about 5 minutes until softened.
  4. Stir in the wild rice, vegetable broth, thyme, and sage. Bring to a boil.
  5. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 1 hour or until rice is tender.
  6. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1/4 cup sugar
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 3/4 cup milk

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
  2. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
  3. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
  4. Stir in milk until just combined.
  5. Turn dough onto a floured surface and knead gently.
  6. Roll out to 1-inch thickness and cut into rounds.
  7. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes until golden.
  8. While the cakes bake, whip the heavy cream with sugar until soft peaks form.
  9. Once the cakes are cool, slice them in half, layer with strawberries and whipped cream, and serve.

🥘 Ingredients

  • 4 cups apples, peeled and sliced
  • 1 cup rolled oats
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour (or gluten-free flour)
  • 1/2 cup vegan butter or regular butter
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. In a large bowl, combine sliced apples, cinnamon, and a bit of brown sugar. Toss to coat.
  3. In another bowl, mix oats, flour, brown sugar, and salt. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
  4. Spread the apple mixture in a baking dish and top with the oat mixture.
  5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the apples are tender and the topping is golden brown.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 60 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 75 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup pumpkin puree
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a loaf pan.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the pumpkin puree, sugar, and vegetable oil until well combined.
  3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the pumpkin mixture, stirring until just combined.
  6. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
  7. Bake for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  8. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 60 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 75 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup pumpkin puree
  • 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup raisins (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the pumpkin puree, vegetable oil, and sugar until well combined.
  3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
  4. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, spices, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Fold in raisins if using.
  6. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
  7. Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
  8. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
